question_text: Which of the following are true about Optical Network Terminals (ONTs)? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: ONTs convert fiber signals into multiple service types like Ethernet and voice
ONTs are usually installed by the customer for cost efficiency
ONTs define the demarcation point for most fiber installations
ONTs typically include RJ11, RJ45, and F-connector outputs
ONTs operate on coaxial backbones in most networks
correct_answer: ONTs convert fiber signals into multiple service types like Ethernet and voice
ONTs typically include RJ11, RJ45, and F-connector outputs
explanation: ONTs handle signal conversion from fiber to usable service interfaces and typically feature RJ11 for voice, RJ45 for data, and F-connectors for video.
